dhbw.LWBS.CA5_KB1.controller
Class AlgorithmUtility

java.lang.Object
  dhbw.LWBS.CA5_KB1.controller.AlgorithmUtility

public class AlgorithmUtility
extends java.lang.Object

Contains all methods that are algorithmic procedures, for example the version space algorithm. The methods are used for both learning and estimation phase.

Method Detail

aqAlgo

public static java.util.Set<Concept> aqAlgo(java.util.ArrayList<Person> positiveExamples,
                                            java.util.ArrayList<Person> negativeExamples)
The Algorithm starts with a new Set of Concepts (also called Hypothesis). After that it starts the iteration over the list of positiveExamples. It passes one positive Example which is a Person and the list of negativeExamples to the method versionSpaceAlgo which returns a Star. The generated star together with the list of positiveExamples is passed to the method bestGeneralization which returns the bestConcept. After it is checked whether the bestConcept is already contained in the Set of Concepts this is returned to the caller of the method.

Parameters:
positiveExamples - a list of positive examples of type Person
negativeExamples - a list of negative examples of type Person
Returns:
Set containing the bestConcept evaluated by the two given lists

addBestConceptIfNotAlreadyCovered

private static void addBestConceptIfNotAlreadyCovered(java.util.Set<Concept> k,
                                                      Concept bestConcept)
Checks if a given Concept evaluated by the method bestGeneralization is already contained in the given Set of Concepts. If it is not contained it is added to this Set otherwise nothing happens.

Parameters:
k - the given Set of Concepts where to look for and add the bestConcept
bestConcept - Concept to be evaluated if contained or not

versionSpaceAlgo

public static Star versionSpaceAlgo(java.util.ArrayList<Person> positiveExamples,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<Person> negativeExamples)
Initialized two lists S and G. S contains underscores meaning no attribute of an example is wanted, G contains stars meaning each attribute of an example is wanted. As long as the given list of positive examples of type Person contains examples one example after another is picked out and list s is generalized. After s is finished it iterates over the list of negative examples and every example that is contained in S will be deleted from S. If S is empty the algorithm fails, otherwise the method goes on.
    Now G is specialized
  1. Check if the current Concept of g covers the current negative example
    • If yes, out of each attribute in S a more specialized concept in G must be generated which replaces the old concept
    • If not, nothing happens
  2. Check if G gone empty
    • If yes, the algorithm has failed
    • If not, program goes on
  3. Check if S and G are already the same
    • If yes, a Star> containing S and G is returned
    • If not, specializing of G goes on with the next negative example
If there are no more negative examples the method returns a Star which contains S and G Concepts.

Parameters:
positiveExamples - a list of positive examples of type Person
negativeExamples - a list of negative examples of type Person
Returns:
Star containing specialized and generalized Concepts, null if list of most specified or most generalized examples runs empty

deleteEqualConcepts

private static void deleteEqualConcepts(java.util.List<Concept> s,
                                        Person a)
Matches every Concept in the List with the given Person example and removes it if they match

Parameters:
s - the List of Concepts which should be cleared from the given Person example
a - the given Person example

versionSpaceAlgo

private static Star versionSpaceAlgo(Person posExample,
                                     java.util.ArrayList<Person> negExamples)
One positive example of type Person which is added to a list and a list of negative examples are passed on to this overloaded method. It then returns a Star which contains specialized and generalized Concepts.

Parameters:
posExample - a list of positive examples of type Person
negExamples - a list of negative examples of type Person
Returns:
Star containing specialized and generalized Concepts, null if list of most specified or most generalized examples runs empty

bestGeneralization

public static Concept bestGeneralization(Star s,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<Person> positiveExamples)
First proofs if the given Star contains generalized Concepts if not no best Concept can be found and null is returned. If this is not the case it is evaluated if each Concept of the given Star coveres each positive example. A local variable counts the covered examples for one Concept. If this number is higher than the one of the previous Concept this is now the best Concept. The last found Concept with the highest number of covered positive examples is returned as best Concept.

Parameters:
s - the Star which should be evalutated for the best generalization
positiveExamples - the given list with positive examples of type Person
Returns:
Concept which covers the most positive examples, null if the given Star has no generalized concepts

guessTheBook

public static java.util.List<Book> guessTheBook(Person p,
                                                java.util.HashMap<Book,java.util.Set<Concept>> booksConcepts)
Calculates the possibility which Book the given Person will pick according to the learned Concepts.

Parameters:
p - Person to be analysed
booksConcepts - all books and their learned Concepts
Returns:
a list of possible books

getPossibleMatches

private static int getPossibleMatches(Person p,
                                      java.util.Set<Concept> bookConcepts)
Returns the number of matches between the given Person and the given book Concepts

Parameters:
p - example of type Person that has to be matched
bookConcepts - containing all concepts of one book
Returns:
number of matches

generalize

private static void generalize(Person p,
                               Concept c)
Compares all attributes of the given Concept to their according enum types. If an attribute wasn't spezialised before the compatible attribute of the given Person is set in the Concept. If a Person's attribute is unequal to the compatible Concept's attribute this is set to a star meaning that it is generalized.

Parameters:
p - Person which is compared to the Concept
c - Concept where to set values

calculatePercentage

private static double calculatePercentage(double matchesForBook,
                                          int total)
Calculated the percentage of matches with the calculated number of getPossibleMatches and the total number of Concepts

Parameters:
matchesForBook - number of matches for a book
total - number of Concepts
Returns:
matches for one book in percentage
